result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jill A. Noyce was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF124 & 14TR1689 called together at 2:00 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jill A. Noyce in court with Attorney Jamie J LaVora. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty LaVora submits plea paperwork & custody credit worksheet

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-14CF124; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CF124 & Case 14TR1689

On Count #1-14CF124, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 10 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment, treatment & child care; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--To pay a fine of $1200 + costs = $2277
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL & Agent approval
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

Conditions Not of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Court does NOT order Victim impact panel attendance as it has already been completed

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:35 pm
Character letters, treatment letters, and a Certificate of completion for VIP submitted by Attorney LaVora
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
for continuance is granted
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF124 & 14TR1689 called together at 2:33 pm
Defendant Jill A. Noyce in court with Attorney Jamie J LaVora. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF124:
DA Happ informs the Court that waiver was done 4/17/14; unless Defense is willing to waive, will have to dismiss and refile.
Atty LaVora waives right to object to untimely filed information; Ms. Noyce agrees: State files information
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered

Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/18/14 at 10:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/14 at 1:15 pm - Send notices

Letter from Attorney LaVora requesting 14TR1698 be set for a status instead of Refusal Hearing on 5/22/14 (with attached stipulation and proposed order)
Arraignment on May 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:13 pm 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jill A. Noyce in court with Attorney Jamie J LaVora. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Noyce waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
ADA Beck informs the Court that they are still awaiting to receive blood results, would like to file at later date so there will be no need to amend information - requests the matter be set out at least 30 days.

Atty LaVora requests that associated TR (14TR1689) also be scheduled at that time - Court grants

NEXT: 14CF124: (1) Schedule Arraignment 5/22/14 at 2:30 pm - Send notices (2) 14TR1689 - Schedule STC 5/22/14 at 2:30 pm - Send notices

Adjourned initial appearance on April 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Unsigned probable cause statement
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:27 pm 
Defendant Jill A. Noyce appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Ms. Noyce is not eligible for SPD representation

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Court presents inclination to adjourn initial appearance until this Friday. Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Ms. Noyce is working this Friday, requests adjourned initial appearance be scheduled on 4/17/14. Court grants.
Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading waived

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 4/7/14 at 2:30 pm. 
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of motor vehicle without a valid d.l.
-  No possession or consumption of illegal drugs

NEXT: (1) Adjourned Initial Appearance Scheduled for 4/17/14 at 2:00 pm (in BrIV) - Send notices
